website_summaries.verdict: An affordable guide that is good for novices who don't want to be overwhelmed with too much information.
pros: Covers rocks and minerals, as well as fossils and land formations
Features key identification points, as well as special sections on where to find rocks and minerals and how to hunt them
cons: Some felt that this guide spent too much time on fossils and land formations and not enough on rocks and minerals

customer_reviews.title: Better options available elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a pocket guide, but it's just too small and thin to cover anything but the smallest fraction of varieties and only those in the most superficial detail. I found it to be of almost no use. The much better option: Simon & Schuster's Guide to Rocks and Minerals. Many more photos and detailed descriptions. It's thicker but doesn't take up much more space.

customer_reviews.title: Great Rock Hound Book
customer_reviews.text: Sarah Garlick has done an excellent job on this particular rock hounding pocket book. It is well worth the asking price. I especially like the way that this book is laid out. It not only shows you the various rocks, minerals and gem stones, but it graphically shows you the various geographical structures that will produce the various rocks, minerals and gem stones in question. This book is very simple to read and understand. I am recommending this book for budding geologists and rock hounds. You will not be disappointed. 5 stars and THANKS to Sarah Garlick.
